field_reports.description:
The torrential rains that fell on the city of Kinshasa on the morning of Saturday, June 14, 2025 caused significant human, material and infrastructure damage in the 24 communes of the capital of the Democratic Republic of Congo. These bad weather conditions are not usual at this time of year when the city is usually already in the dry season period.

In its capacity as an auxiliary of the public authorities, the Red Cross of the Democratic Republic of Congo deployed volunteers in 24 communes of the capital to help the victims and evacuate pregnant women, children, people living with disabilities and people of the 3rdage in the flooded areas to the non-flooded places and then conducted a rapid assessment.

The data of the first go is the result carried out in the 17 municipalities out of the 24 in the city carried out by 295 volunteers. It should be noted that the houses disinfected and disinsectized from the rains of April 4 to 5 and 11, 2025 are once again flooded.
field_reports.summary: COD: Flood - 06-2025 - Flooding in the city of Kinshasa

field_reports.description:
The torrential rains that fell in the Territory of Fizi, Kazamba Village, Ubwari Peninsula, Kandja Sector,  South Kivu Province on the night of May 08 to 09, 2025, caused the overflow of the Kasaba River, several houses with human people, battles and material goods were carried away in Lake Tanganyika and others buried under sand and large stones.
This heavy rain was accompanied by strong winds, which caused the roofs of some houses and several fields of food crops to be destroyed and washed away.
This disastrous situation has caused the cessation and/or disruption of the activities of the population in the UBWARI peninsula.
field_reports.summary: COD: Flood - 05-2025 - Floods in Kasaba village, Territory of FIzi in the Province of South Kivu

field_reports.description:
The torrential rains that fell on April 5, 2025 in the city of Kinshasa, the capital of the Democratic Republic of Congo, caused flooding, landslides and silting up in 13 municipalities out of the 24 municipalities of the city of Kinshasa (Matete, Kisenso, Ngaba, Limete, Mount Ngafula,  Ndjil Kalamu,  Bumbu, Ngaliema, Selembao, Makala, Lemba and  Masina) following the rise of the waters of the Ndjili River, these rains returned once again on Sunday, April 6, 2025 and  continued on April 11, 2025 caused desolation in several households in terms of loss of human lives and material on the one hand, and on the other hand it is either the silting up of houses, or the destruction of houses (totally or partially); This situation has put many households in an unexpected situation of vulnerability at the beginning of 2025.
The mattress service reports the fall of similar heavy rains that will continue until May  2025 and if we are careful, the situation could go from bad to worse.
field_reports.summary: COD: Flood - 04-2025 - Flooding in the city of Kinshasa

field_reports.description:
The situation following the rains on the night of 5 to 6 April 2025 aggravated the floods that occurred between 28 and 29 March 2025. The flooding led to an increased overflow of the Rugumba River, which overflowed its banks to invade homes, causing significant material damage and jeopardizing children's education.

We report that the same situation was observed in Nyunzu territory, where heavy rains fell on 27 March as well as those from 5 to 6 April, resulting in significant destruction, including the destruction of houses and the impact on two primary schools. These are the EP Kavuma School, which has six classrooms recently built by UNICEF and is home to 329 students, including 169 girls, as well as the EP MSaadi School, where six classrooms have been completely affected, hosting 274 students, including 137 girls and three schools collapsed on April 5.

In addition, in the same territory, the Lipanda Pond suffered severe flooding, threatening some neighborhoods and displacing more than 700 households to more secure areas. Many of the victims, mainly women and children, are staying with host families. Farmers in the region deplore the submersion of several hectares of cassava, maize and groundnut fields.
field_reports.summary: COD: Flood - 04-2025 - Flooding in Tanganyika province

field_reports.description:
On Friday night of March 07, 2025, the villages on the banks of the Congo River in the  health areas of Elila, Lokando, Pembeliba, Lubao1, Lubao2, Mingazi mbili in Kailo territory were surprised by a torrential rain accompanied by a strong  wind that caused very significant human and material damage. It should be noted that in recent years, the province of Maniema has observed unusually enormous atmospheric disturbances (flooding, heavy and torrential rains, strong winds, etc.) which are destabilizing communities. These phenomena, which are not yet under control by the population and the authorities, cause so much enormous damage. According to experts, these phenomena are effects of climate disruption.

Among these damages, the following were the removal of roofs or frameworks, the collapse or collapse of the walls of family homes and public buildings (schools, health centres, churches, etc.), the loss of food stocks for families, etc.

Many latrines and wells were flooded in all these areas, raising fears of waterborne diseases.

Among the victims of this crisis are children, people with disabilities, the elderly, the chronically ill, pregnant women, single mothers, etc.
field_reports.summary: COD: Flood - 03-2025 - Floods in Maniema in Kailo territory

field_reports.description:
The province of Haut-Uélé is confronted by various health and security problems (community conflict in Sambie in the territory of Dungu) and artificial disaster (fire in Giro in the territory of Watsa, Gomba health zone 287 km from the city of ISIRO, capital of the province).  

As for the fire in Giro, the local source, informs that on January 09, 2025, a fire occurred around 2 p.m. local time following a dispute between an economic operator and his employer who was claiming his salary money at the AYILI hotel, Since his employer was not satisfied with his boss's response, he poured himself fuel to succeed himself, burning the AYILI hotel had caught fire which spread to other houses in the village.
field_reports.summary: COD: Fire - 01-2025 - fire in GIRO in the territory of WATSA, Haut-Uele Province

field_reports.description:
The rising waters of Lake Tanganyika have caused flooding in two provinces of the DRC, namely  the province of Tanganyika and South Kivu.

In South Kivu, it is the increase and increase of the Mulongwe, Kalimabenge, Kamvimvira and Kabimba rivers of the incorporated group of Kalungwe, in the health area of Kabibba which destroys the houses and fields surrounding the town hall and harms the lives of the peaceful citizens living along the river in the city of Uvira. Currently, the 9 districts, namely : Kavimvira, Kasenga,  Kakombe,   Rombe,  Kimanga,  Nyamianda,  Kilibula,   Kalundu  and Kabimba are all strongly affected by this rise and overflow of the waters of the above-mentioned rivers.

This rise in waters, the overflowing of the rivers have caused several consequences in the destruction of several houses and several fields in the vicinity of Nyangara and Kabimba, so several people are affected by this disaster and are accommodated some in Host Families, others have joined others in disaster sites, others are in unfinished houses and others are still resisting in their flooded homes across the town of Uvira and the cluster in Kalungwe.

The situation is also deplorable for the province of Tanganyika where the rise in the waters of the lake is only accentuating in the territories of Moba, Kabalo, Kongolo, Manono and the city of Kalemie where even the pits, the  latrines are flooded and emptied, The feces flow into the lakes where the inhabitants get their water. With a higher risk of contamination from waterborne diseases.
field_reports.summary: COD: Flood - 04-2024 - Floods in South Kivu and Tanganyika provinces

results.name: COD: Flood - 04-2024 - Floods in South Kivu and Tanganyika provinces
results.summary:
La montée des eaux du lac Tanganyika, ont provoqué les inondations dans deux provinces de la RDC savoir  la province de Tanganyika et le Sud-Kivu.

Dans la province du Sud-Kivu c’est l’augmentation et l’accru des rivières Mulongwe, Kalimabenge, Kamvimvira et Kabimba du groupement incorporé de Kalungwe, dans l’aire de santé de KABIMBA qui détruit les maisons et les champs environnant la mairie et met à mal la vie de les paisibles citoyens riverains dans la ville d’Uvira. Actuellement les 9 quartiers à savoir : Kavimvira, Kasenga,  Kakombe,   Rombe,  Kimanga,  Nyamianda,  Kilibula,   Kalundu  et Kabimba sont tous fortement touchés par cette monté et le débordement des eaux des rivières ci-haut citées.

Cette monté des eaux, les débordements des rivières ont provoqués plusieurs conséquences en destruction de plusieurs maisons et plusieurs champs sur les environs de Nyangara et Kabimba, ainsi plusieurs personnes sont touchées par cette catastrophe et sont hébergées certains dans des Familles d’accueils, d’autres ont rejoints les autres dans les sites des sinistrés, d’autres sont dans les maisons inachevées et d’autres résistent encore dans leurs maisons inondées à travers la ville d’Uvira et le groupement à Kalungwe.

La situation est aussi déplorable pour la province de Tanganyika ou la montée des eaux du lac ne fais que s’accentuer dans les territoires Moba, Kabalo, Kongolo, Manono et la ville de Kalemie ou même les fosses, les  latrines sont inondées et vidées, les matières fécales se déversent dans les lacs ou les habitants s’approvisionnent en eau. Avec un risque plus élevé de la contamination des maladies d’origine hydrique.

results.name: COD: Population Movement - 02-2024 - DRC
results.summary:
Since the beginning of 2024, an intensification of the conflict between the armed forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) and their allies against M23 rebel group has had devastating effects on civilians in several towns within North Kivu. Notably, the towns of Mweso, Bambo, Katsiru, Sake, and Goma have been severely impacted. The M23 armed groups have blocked the two main roads leading into Goma, a major city in the region with a population of approximately two million people. As a result, Goma is now isolated from the surrounding farms that supply it with essential resources for now several days.

The ongoing fighting has forced the displacement of around 135,000 people to Goma and an additional 100,000 people into South Kivu (specifically Minova). These displaced individuals face immense challenges, including limited access to basic necessities. The conflict situation is severely restricting humanitarian access to hundreds

of thousands of people in need. The sites designated for internally displaced persons (IDPs) in Goma are overloaded and unable to accommodate new arrivals. International humanitarian organizations operating in the region are facing operational challenges. Some of these organizations are reducing their capacity by evacuating and relocating personnel based in Goma. While most analysts consider a full takeover of Goma by M23 to be unlikely, such an event would have catastrophic humanitarian consequences not only within eastern DRC but also in neighboring countries.

results.name: COD: 01-2024 Floods
results.summary:
The Democratic Republic of Congo is currently experiencing its worst Congo River flooding in 60 years, following weeks of heavy rainfall. As of December 29, 2023, the Government of the Republic of Congo already issued an alert for the level of the Congo River with a flood of 5.94m. As of January 10, the river level was still above the overflow threshold, 6.20 meters above sea level, close to the 1961 record of 6.26 meters. This statement by the Reuters agency Ferry Mowa (hydrology specialist of the DRC Waterways Authority), maintains the level of emergency in several provinces already severely affected by violent floods for several weeks with about 300 deaths in the two Congos. Following the deadly toll and the impact of the floods presented on January 5, the Minister of Social Affairs, Humanitarian Actions and National Solidarity of the DRC launched an appeal for solidarity and emergency relief addressed to the authorities of the Central Government and to the entire national and international community in order to allow the deployment of substantial aid and teams on the ground.

According to the monitoring of the Régie des voies fluviales, the most affected provinces are: Tshopo, Mongala, Equateur, North Ubangi and South Ubangi, Kwilu, Mai-Ndombe, Kongo-Central, Lomami, Kasai, Kasai-Central, South Kivu, Haut Uele, Kinshasa and Tshuapa.

These floods observed across the Republic have affected 304,521 households, In addition, more than 43,750 houses have collapsed, 1325 schools destroyed, 269 health centers affected, 41 public markets affected and 85 agricultural service roads devastated

field_reports.description:
The torrential rains that have fallen in six provinces of the DRC since November 2023 in the provinces of Haut-Uélé, Nord-Ubangi, Sud-Ubangi, Tshopo, Mongala and Equateur its aggravated on December 6, 2023 caused flooding in the agglomeration grade of these provinces for the province of Haut Uéle in the territories of: Faradje, Niangara and Dungu, in the province of Nord-Ubangi      the city of Gbadolite and the territories of Businga, Mobayi Bongo, Yakoma and Bosobolo, in the province of Sud-Ubangi the city of Zongo, in the province of Tshopo the six communes of the city of Kisangani (Makiso, Kisangani, Lubunga, Mangobo, Tshopo and the commune of Kisangani) and the territories of Banalia, Isangi, Basoko, Ubundu and Yahuma, in Mongala Province Bumba Territory, Lisala City, Lisala / Binga Territory, Bongandaka Territory and in Equateur Province the territory of Bomongo, territory of Mankanza , in the city of Mbandaka and      in the territory of Bolomba.

Several households have lost their essential household goods.

Thousands of fields  are engulfed in water, latrines and water points are also  submerged.
field_reports.summary: COD: Flood - 12-2023 - Floods in six provinces of DRC / Haut-Uele, Nord-Ubangi, Sud-Ubangi, Tshopo, Mongala and Equateur #2 (2023-12-08)

field_reports.description:
The 2023 election calendar is as follows:

·       >From 18.11 to 18.12.23: Election campaign

·       >20.12.23                      : Vote

·       31.12.23                      : Publication of provisional results

                                      of the presidential elections

·       >10.01.24                      : Final results released

 

The situation across the country is apparently calm, but it may deteriorate as we get closer to the elections. Although all the candidates for the office of President of the Republic  have all been accepted by the Independent Electoral Commission. In general, since independence in the DRC, elections are always characterized by violence with loss of human and material lives and following several opposition leaders who continue to express their dissatisfaction with the electoral process,  we believe this is likely to happen again.

Political conflicts between opponents from the same province or them who are in the   power from the same province for positioning leaves   fear an outbreak of violence in the next election.

Given everything that's going on and having the stakes around these elections,   There could be harmful consequences of protest. Although there are no visible signs of violence ahead of elections.

To do this, the DRC Red Cross would do better to prepare for any situations that may happen to the countries following the elections and will have to start already Reinforce the teams of its volunteers in the country's hotspots, in order to assist  the population during the clashes of the different tendencies
field_reports.summary: COD: Other - 10-2023 - Election Preparation

                                      of the presidential elections

·       >10.01.24                      : Final results released

 

The situation across the country is apparently calm, but it may deteriorate as we get closer to the elections. Although all the candidates for the office of President of the Republic  have all been accepted by the Independent Electoral Commission. In general, since independence in the DRC, elections are always characterized by violence with loss of human and material lives and following several opposition leaders who continue to express their dissatisfaction with the electoral process,  we believe this is likely to happen again.

Political conflicts between opponents from the same province or them who are in the   power from the same province for positioning leaves   fear an outbreak of violence in the next election.

Given everything that's going on and having the stakes around these elections,   There could be harmful consequences of protest. Although there are no visible signs of violence ahead of elections.

To do this, the DRC Red Cross would do better to prepare for any situations that may happen to the countries following the elections and will have to start already Reinforce the teams of its volunteers in the country's hotspots, in order to assist  the population during the clashes of the different tendencies

field_reports.description:
Dans la nuit du 4 au 5 mai 2023, une pluie torencielle s'est abatue sur les villages de Bushushu et Nyamukubi dans le territoire de Kalehe dans la province du Sud-Kivu. Cela s'est poursuivi le 6 mai 2023 et a occasionné des inondations et des éboulements de terrain, causant environ 400 morts, plusieurs personnes disparues et des pertes en moyen de subsistance.

La Croix-Rouge de la RDC à travers sa Branche du Sud-Kivu a deployé une équipe sur le terrain pour des évaluations rapides et contribuer à l'assistances humanitaire aux personnes sinistrées.
field_reports.summary: COD: Flood - 2023-05 - Inondation Kalehe

results.name: COD: Flood - 2023-05 - Inondation Kalehe
results.summary:
On the night of May 4 to 5, 2023, a torencial rain fell on the villages of Bushushu and Nyamukubi in the territory of Kalehe in the province of South Kivu. This continued on May 6, 2023 and caused flooding and landslides, causing approximately 400 deaths, several missing people and loss of livelihoods.

The DRC Red Cross, through its South Kivu Branch, has deployed a team on the ground for rapid assessments and to contribute to humanitarian assistance to the affected people.

field_reports.description:
The torrential rains that fell on the night of  April 5 to 6  , 2025 in the city of Kinshasa, the capital of the Democratic Republic of Congo, caused flooding, landslides and silting up in 13 municipalities out of the 24 municipalities of the city of Kinshasa (Matete, Kisenso, Ngaba, Limete, Mont Ngafula,  Ndjil, Kalamu,  Bumbu, Ngaliema, Selembao, Makala, Lemba and  Masina) following the rise of the waters of the Ndjil River; these rains continued once again on Sunday, April 6, 2025 and caused desolation in several households in terms of loss of human and material lives on the one hand, and on the other hand it is either the silting up of houses, or the destruction of houses (totally or partially); This situation has put many households in an unexpected situation of vulnerability at the beginning of 2025.
The mattress service reports the fall of similar heavy rains that will continue until May  2025 and if we are careful, the situation could go from bad to worse.
field_reports.summary: COD: Flood - 04-2025 - Flooding in the city of Kinshasa

field_reports.description:
Les pluies diluvienne qui se sont abattues dans la ville de Kinshasa le mardi 13 décembre de 2 heures jusqu’à 7 heures 30 du matin ont causé des inondations par la suite débordement des rivières qui traversent la ville.

Ces inondations ont cause des dégâts matériels et humains importants notamment l’écroulement partiels et total des maisons dans 16 communes de la ville de Kinshasa avec perte en vies humaines.

Une évaluation rapide a été menée par les volontaires secouristes, qui nous permis d’obtenir les données suivant.

results.name: COD: Flood - 2022-12 - Floods in the city of Kinshasa
results.summary:
The torrential rains that fell in the city of Kinshasa on Tuesday, December 13 from 2 a.m. to 7:30 a.m. caused flooding after the rivers that flow through the city.

These floods have caused significant material and human damage, including the partial and total collapse of houses in 16 communes of the city of Kinshasa with loss of human lives.

A rapid assessment was carried out by the rescue volunteers, which allowed us to obtain the following data.

field_reports.description:
North Kivu has been facing a crisis of armed confrontation between the Armed Forces and the 23 Movement since March 2022.

The city of Goma and some outlying villages in Nyiragongo territory continue to receive a large number of displaced persons in several waves following repeated clashes and the occupation of several villages in Rutshuru territory. Masisi and Nyiragongo by the M23.

Currently, the estimated number of IDPs in the reception sites is about 115906 households divided into nine health areas, including Munigi with nearly 13,959 households, Kanyaruchinya with nearly 21,785 households, Kibati with nearly 4806 households, Mudja with nearly 2728 households, Rusayo with nearly 23,213 households, Himbi with nearly 2121  households, Mugunga with nearly 17566 households and Buhimba with about 35909 households. 

The source informs that the displaced are also in the territory of Minova and in the city of Bukavu in the province of South Kivu.

The displaced are mainly in churches, schools, haggard towns, construction sites and large sites along the RN2. The number of host families has not yet been controlled, especially since several households have been welcomed with their relatives in the city of Goma and in the part of the territory of Nyiragongo still under the control of the FARDC.  

The city of Goma is surrounded, and the city of Sake is the next target of the  M23.

field_reports.description:
Les détenus dans la prison centrale de la ville de Kamitunga, territoire de Mwenga, sont actuellement victimes d’une maladie mortelle non encore élucidée. Il s’agit d’une maladie diarrhéique semblable au Cholera qui a déjà atteint plus de 30 malades (26 en prison et 4 dans la communauté) dont 14 décès. 
Les malades sont en train d’être acheminés progressivement vers l’hôpital général de référence de Kamituga pour des soins.
field_reports.summary: COD: Épidémie - 2022-11 - L'épidémie de cholera à BUkavu

results.name: COD: Epidemic - 2022-11 - The Cholera Epidemic in BUkavu
results.summary:
Inmates in the central prison of the town of Kamitunga, Mwenga territory, are currently victims of a fatal disease that has not yet been elucidated. It is a diarrhoeal disease similar to Cholera that has already affected more than 30 patients (26 in prison and 4 in the community), including 14 deaths. 
The patients are being gradually transported to the Kamituga General Referral Hospital for treatment.

field_reports.description:
L'augmentation inquiétante des cas de choléra dans la Zone de Santé  de Kalemie à la semaine 39 au cours de laquelle la zone a notifié 50 cas de choléra contre 17 à la semaine 38, soit un accroissement de 66%. L'aires de santé de Kataki (quartier Kataki1 à Kamokolobondo) reste l'épicentre de l'épidémie 32 cas de choléra notifiés à la semaine 39 contre 5 cas à la semaine 38, soit un accroissement de 84,3%.

La situation risque d'être explosive dans les prochaines semaines, avec la coupure du courant annoncée par la société nationale électricité  et le retour de la saison pluvieuse.
	
La situation reste également inquiétante dans plusieurs autres zone de sante notamment Nyemba et Ankoro où le risque de déclenchement d'une grande l'épidémie reste certaine.
En date du 4 Octobre le maire de la ville de Kalemie a déclaré l’épidémie de choléra après 70 Cas enregistrés
field_reports.summary: COD: Épidémie - 2022-10 - L’épidémie de choléra dans la ville de Kalemie province de Tanganyika

results.name: COD: Outbreak - 2022-10 - Cholera outbreak in Kalemie city, Tanganyika province
results.summary:
The worrying increase in cholera cases in Kalemie Health Zone in week 39 during which the zone reported 50 cases of cholera compared to 17 in week 38, an increase of 66%. The Kataki health area (Kataki 1 district in Kamokolobondo) remains the epicenter of the epidemic, with 32 cases of cholera reported in week 39 compared to 5 cases in week 38, an increase of 84.3%.

The situation is likely to be explosive in the coming weeks, with the power cut announced by the national electricity company and the return of the rainy season.
	
The situation also remains worrying in several other health zones, including Nyemba and Ankoro, where the risk of a major epidemic remains certain.
On October 4, the mayor of the city of Kalemie declared a cholera epidemic after 70 cases were recorded

field_reports.description:
Selon le rapport du Secrétariat Général du Ministère de la Santé Publique, Hygiène et Prévention de la Direction Générale de Lutte contre la Maladie, Direction Surveillance Epidémiologique et l’OMS du 23 septembre 2022, vient confirmer la recrudescence de la méningite dans la Zone de Santé  de Banalia depuis la semaine 25. Les aires de santé frappées sont celle de MANGI l’épicentre actuelle, celle de BONGONZA située au Nord-est de la première et AKUMA, toutes situées sur la rive droite de la rivière Arwimi. Pour rappel, cette aire de santé était parmi celles qui avaient enregistré beaucoup plus des cas, soit deuxième derrière PANGA. Mangi est une zone minière comme PANGA avec un mouvement pendulaire de population très fort.
Cette maladie se caractérise par des céphalées atroces, des courbatures, de vomissement et raideur de coud, puis s’en suis la mort entre le 3ème et le 4ème jour. Aussi, nous voudrions signaler que la Croix-Rouge, n’avait pas intervenu dans cette aire de santé. Selon le rapport du Secrétariat Général du Ministère de la Santé Publique, Hygiène et Prévention de la Direction Générale de Lutte contre la Maladie, Direction Surveillance Epidémiologique et l’OMS du 23 septembre 2022.
field_reports.summary: COD: Épidémie - 2022-09 - Recrudescence de l'épidémie de méningite dans la Zone de Santé  de Banalia province de Tshopo.

results.name: COD: Epidemic - 2022-09 - Resurgence of the meningitis epidemic in the Banalia Health Zone of Tshopo province.
results.summary:
According to the report of the General Secretariat of the Ministry of Public Health, Hygiene and Prevention of the General Directorate for Disease Control, Epidemiological Surveillance Directorate and the WHO of September 23, 2022, confirms the resurgence of meningitis in the Banalia Health Zone since week 25. The health areas affected are MANGI, the current epicenter, BONGONZA located northeast of the first and AKUMA, all located on the right bank of the Arwimi River. As a reminder, this health area was among those that had recorded many more cases, second only to PANGA. Mangi is a mining area like PANGA with a very strong commuting movement.
This disease is characterized by excruciating headaches, aches, vomiting and stiff elbows, and then death between the 3rd and 4th day. Also, we would like to point out that the Red Cross had not intervened in this health area. According to the report of the General Secretariat of the Ministry of Public Health, Hygiene and Prevention of the General Directorate for Disease Control, Epidemiological Surveillance Directorate and the WHO of September 23, 2022.

results.name: DRC - 15th Ebola Outbreak
results.summary:
On August 22, 2022, the Democratic Republic of Congo declared a new case of Ebola Virus Disease (EVD) in the town of Beni, Beni health zone located in North Kivu province. According to the authorities, the history of this case dates back to July 23, 2022 with the hospitalization of a 46-year-old female widow at the Beni General Referral Hospital, who died in respiratory distress in an immunosuppressed HIV-Tuberculosis setting on August 15, 2022 in the Intensive Care Unit of the Beni General Referral Hospital, in Beni Territory in North Kivu Province. A routine oro-pharyngeal swab was performed on August 15, 2022 by the HGR Beni team. The sample tested positive for EVD at the Beni laboratory and was confirmed at the INRB laboratory in Goma. Sequencing performed at the Rodolphe Mérieux Laboratory of INRB-Goma confirmed the Ebola Zaire strain and further demonstrated that this case is related to a strain from the tenth outbreak of 2018 in November in Beni and not to a new introduction of the virus. 

 

The epicenter of the disease is the Butanuka Health Area, Beni Health Zone, in North Kivu Province. The town of Beni is accessible by air and land. It is 52 km from the city of Butembo, 372 km from Goma and about 80 km from the border town of Kasindi with Uganda. There is also an exit road that directly connects the city of Beni with the city of Bunia in Ituri Province and the city of Kisangani in Tshopo Province.

field_reports.description:
La zone de santé de Banalia dans Territoire de Banalia province de Tshopo connaît une recrudescence de la méningite depuis la semaine 34 dans l’aire de santé de MANGI. 

Durant les quatre derniers mois de 2021,  la méningite a fait plus de 200 décès, sur plus de mille  cas notifiés.  L’épidémie avait été maîtrisée grâce à l’implication du  gouvernement de la République et ses partenaires dont la Croix-Rouge de la RDC. Jusqu’à la semaine 35, plus de 41 cas sont enregistrés dans l’aire de santé de MANGI, dont 11 décès. Pour rappel, cette aire de santé était parmi celles qui avaient enregistré beaucoup plus des cas, soit deuxième derrière PANGA.
field_reports.summary: COD: Épidémie - 2022-08 - L'épidémie de méningite dans le territoire de Banalia,  province de Tshope /RDC

results.name: COD: Epidemic - 2022-08 - The meningitis epidemic in Banalia territory, Tshope province / DRC
results.summary:
The Banalia health zone in Banalia Territory, Tshopo province, has been experiencing an upsurge in meningitis since week 34 in the MANGI health area. 

In the last four months of 2021, meningitis caused more than 200 deaths, out of more than a thousand reported cases.  The epidemic had been brought under control thanks to the involvement of the Government of the Republic and its partners, including the DRC Red Cross. As of week 35, more than 41 cases have been recorded in the MANGI health area, including 11 deaths. As a reminder, this health area was among those that had recorded many more cases, second only to PANGA.

field_reports.affected_pop_centres: La ville de Zongo Province du Sud-Ubangi, le territoire de Lubutu Province de Maniema et la ville d''Isiro dans la Province du Haut-Uele
field_reports.description:
La République Démocratique du Congo à deux saisons à savoir : la saison de pluie et la saison  sèche dans sa partie de l’est  nous entamons la période de pluies depuis le mois d’aout 2022. De fortes pluies ont affecté trois provinces du l’est, la province du Sud-Ubangi dans la ville de Zongo, la province de Manieme dans le territoire de Lubutu et la province du Haut-Uele dans la ville d’Isiro. Ces pluies ont occasionné la montée des eaux des différentes rivières qui traverse ses zones depuis le 8 aout 2022 et cette montée des eaux progresse jusqu’à ce jour
Plus de 622 184 personnes reparties de manière suivant : la province du Sud-Ubangi dans la ville de Zongo 611 915 personnes, la province de Manieme dans le territoire de Lubutu 6634 personnes et la province du Haut-Uele dans la ville d’Isiro 3635 peronnes ont été touchées depuis le début  du mois aout. Toutefois, des pertes de vies humaines, des biens matériels  et des maisons détruites totalement et partiellement ont été signalées. D’autres estiment que leurs stocks de denrées alimentaires et biens matériels auraient été emportés par les eaux.
La CRRDC a été informée ce jour, à travers ses comités provinciaux de trois provinces qui ont menées la première évaluation. Les volontaires ont été  déployés  sur le terrain pour une réponse rapide en le premier secours,  l’évacuation et  une évaluation rapide de la situation des personnes affectées.
field_reports.summary: COD: Inondation - 2022-08 - Les inondations dans les provinces des Maniema, Sud-Ubangi et Haut-Uele

results.name: COD: Flood - 2022-08 - Floods in the provinces of Maniema, Sud-Ubangi and Haut-Uele
results.summary:
The Democratic Republic of Congo has two seasons, namely: the rainy season and the dry season in its eastern part we have been starting the rainy period since August 2022. Heavy rains affected three eastern provinces, Sud-Ubangi province in the city of Zongo, Manieme province in Lubutu territory and Haut-Uele province in the city of Isiro. These rains have caused the rise in the waters of the various rivers that cross its areas since August 8, 2022 and this rise in water is progressing to this day
More than 622,184 people distributed as follows: the province of Sud-Ubangi in the city of Zongo 611,915 people, the province of Manieme in the territory of Lubutu 6634 people and the province of Haut-Uele in the city of Isiro 3635 people have been affected since the beginning of August. However, loss of life, property and houses totally and partially destroyed were reported. Others believe that their stocks of food and material goods have been swept away by the water.
The CRRDC was informed today, through its provincial committees of three provinces that conducted the first evaluation. Volunteers were deployed to the field for a rapid response in first aid, evacuation and a rapid assessment of the situation of those affected.

field_reports.description:
Les pluies diluviennes qui  sont abattues depuis le 15 octobre 2022 et se poursuivis jusqu’à au  mercredi  17 octobre 2022, dans la commune rurale de Lubutu   et ses environs dans le territoire Lubutu, province de Manieme, ont causé des dégâts matériels et ont provoqué le déplacement de la population.

Le territoire de Lubutu qui est l’un de sept de territoires de la province de  Maniema (au nord Maniema) avec une population totale de 611915 habitats sur une superficie de 16055 km². Limité à l’est par le territoire de walikale de la province du Nord-Kivu traverse la rivière oso, au sud par le territoire de Punia qui est traverse par la rivière yumbi, à l’ouest par le territoire d’ubundu de la province de Tshopo qui est traverse par la rivière Ayane et au nord par le territoire de Bafasende de la province de Tshopo traverse par la rivière Maiko.

Silonns que la commune rurale de Lubutu se trouve au milieu des rivières lubilinga, kalibatete, nyafanza, ndeka et moyo.

Population vit dans les familles d’accueil et dans les écoles de la place
field_reports.summary: COD: Inondation - 2022-08 - Les inondations dans le territoire rural de Lubutu province de Maniema

results.name: COD: Flood - 2022-08 - Floods in the rural territory of Lubutu province of Maniema
results.summary:
The torrential rains that  have been falling since October 15, 2022 and continued until  Wednesday,  October 17, 2022, in the rural commune of Lubutu   and its surroundings in Lubutu territory, Manieme province, have caused material damage and caused the displacement of the population.

The territory of Lubutu which is one of seven territories in the province of  Maniema (north Maniema) with a total population of 611915 habitats on an area of 16055 km². It is bounded to the east by the Walikale territory of the province of North Kivu and crosses the Oso River, to the south by the territory of Punia which is crossed by the Yumbi River, to the west by the Ubundu territory of the province of Tshopo which is crossed by the Ayane River and to the north by the territory of Bafasende of the province of Tshopo crossed by the Maiko River.

According to the rural commune of Lubutu is located in the middle of the Lubilinga, Kalibatete, Nyafanza, Ndeka and Moyo rivers.

Population lives in foster families and in local schools

field_reports.description:
Le lundi 15 août 2022, le laboratoire mobile de Beni de l'Institut National de Recherche Biomédicale (INRB) a reçu un échantillon de sécrétion oropharyngée prélevé sur un patient décédé qui était pris en charge à l'Hôpital Général de Référence de Beni (HGR-Beni). L’échantillon a été testé positif pour le virus Ebola (EBOV) à l'aide du test Cepheid Xpert Ebola avec des valeurs ct de 32,5 pour la glycoprotéine virale (GP) et de 28,2 pour la nucléoprotéine virale (NP). Pour contrôle qualité et confirmation, des prélèvements ont été envoyés au Laboratoire Rodolphe Mérieux INRB-Goma le mardi 16 août 2022, où l'analyse a confirmé le cas de MVE.
 
La patiente a été admise le 23 juillet 2022 au service de médecine interne de l'HGR-Beni pour toux, céphalées, polyarthralgies, asthénie physique intense remontant à plusieurs jours et pour lesquelles elle s'était automédicamentée avec des médicaments non précisés. Elle était séropositive sous traitement antirétroviral et elle avait également présenté une tuberculose pour laquelle elle recevait un traitement antituberculeux.  Le 13 août 2022, son état de santé s'est détérioré avec l'apparition d'une congestion bronchique et d'une insuffisance rénale, ce qui a incité son transfert aux soins intensifs pour une meilleure prise en charge. Elle est décédée le 15 août 2022. Au total, son hospitalisation a duré 23 jours..
field_reports.summary: COD: Incendie - 2022-08 - Epidémie Ebola à Beni

results.name: COD: Fire - 2022-08 - Ebola outbreak in Beni
results.summary:
On Monday, August 15, 2022, the Beni mobile laboratory of the National Institute for Biomedical Research (INRB) received a sample of oropharyngeal secretion taken from a deceased patient who was being treated at the General Reference Hospital of Beni (HGR-Beni). The sample tested positive for Ebola virus (EBOV) using the Cepheid Xpert Ebola assay with ct values of 32.5 for viral glycoprotein (GP) and 28.2 for viral nucleoprotein (NP). For quality control and confirmation, samples were sent to the Rodolphe Mérieux INRB-Goma Laboratory on Tuesday, August 16, 2022, where the analysis confirmed the EVD case.
 
The patient was admitted on July 23, 2022 to the internal medicine department of HGR-Beni for cough, headache, polyarthralgia, intense physical asthenia dating back several days and for which she had self-medicated with unspecified medications. She was HIV-positive on antiretroviral therapy and had also developed tuberculosis for which she was receiving TB treatment.  On August 13, 2022, his health deteriorated with the onset of bronchial congestion and kidney failure, prompting his transfer to intensive care for better management. She died on August 15, 2022. In total, his hospitalization lasted 23 days.

field_reports.epi_notes_since_last_fr:
La République  Démocratique  du Congo,  notre pays vient  d’enregistrer une nouvelle résurgence du virus d’Ebola dans la province de l’Equateur est survenu dans la zone de santé de Wangata,  ville de Mbandaka.
Il s’agit d’un étudiant de 31 ans,  hospitalisé en date du 19 avril  2022 à l’hôpital Général  de Wangata,  décédé  dans le tableau  hémorragique le 21 avril 2022  au centre de Wangata,  un prélèvement sanguin puis un Swab ont été effectués à la même date   par l’équipe de  l’Hôpital Général  de Wangata,  teste à Mbandaka et au centre de traitement d’Ebola,  les 2 échantillons ont été teste positifs  à Mbandaka puis envoyés  à l’ Institut national de recherche biomédicale de Kinshasa pour contrôle qualité  et le résultant est revenu aussi positif au virus Ebola.
field_reports.summary: COD: Epidemic - 2022-04 - La résurgence du virus d'Ebola dans la province de l'Equateur

field_reports.epi_notes_since_last_fr:
La Division Provinciale de la Sante de la province d’Ituri est composée de 36 Zone de santé.  Avec une population de près de 6 800000 habitants. La peste a été effectivement notifiée dans la Zone de santé de Rethy  ayant une population de (253 631 habitants ),  précisément dans les Aires de santé de Lokpa et Rassia. Déclaré par le Chef de la Division Provinciale de la Santé, le 06/04/2022.  Cependant en date du 07/ 04/2022, la situation épidémiologique se présente comme suivante ; 31 cas notifiés, 2 décès et près de 2000 contacts listés. 
Pour rappel, le 07 janvier 2022, dans  cette même ZS dans l’AS UKETHA, il avait la notification d’un cas de la peste dont  les volontaires de la Croix-Rouge avaient mémés la riposte avec les activités (sensibilisations, assainissements, décontaminations, surveillance à base  communautaire) et grâce à ces activités, la chaine de contamination était coupée.
field_reports.description: Vu le nombre élevé de cas de contact et par manqué des tests pour dianoétique  la maladie  dans la zone  de sante Rethy,  il y a risque de la flambe de la maladie, jusqu’ont aujourd’hui seulement  deux aires de sante qui sont touches par la maladie.

field_reports.description:
North Kivu has been facing a crisis of armed confrontation between the Armed Forces and the March 23 Movement for more than a year.

The city of Goma and the outlying villages in Nyiragongo territory continue to receive a significant number of displaced persons in several waves following repeated clashes and  the occupation of several villages in Rutshuru territory. Masisi and Nyiragongo by the M23.

The sorce points out that there is also the presence of displaced people in the territory of Minova and in the city of Bukavu in the province of South Kivu

Currently, the estimated number of IDPs in the reception sites is about 115906 households divided into nine health areas, including Munigi with nearly 13,959 households, Kanyaruchinya with nearly 21,785 households, Kibati with nearly 4806 households, Mudja with nearly 2728 households, Rusayo with nearly 23,213 households, Himbi with nearly 2121  households, Mugunga with nearly 17566 households and Buhimba with about 35909 households.

The displaced are mainly in churches, schools, haggard towns, construction sites and large sites along the RN2. The number of host families has not yet been controlled, especially since several households have been welcomed with their relatives in the city of Goma and in the part of the territory of Nyiragongo still under the control of the FARDC.  

The city of Goma is surrounded, and the city of Sake is the next target of the  M23.
field_reports.summary: Population movement in the provinces of North Kivu and South Kivu in the DRC

field_reports.epi_notes_since_last_fr:
Dans l’intervalle du 5 au 7 septembre 2021, dans l’aire de santé de Butsili  la zone de santé de Beni, en territoire de Beni Province du Nord-Kivu, un père et son enfant se sont rendus à un centre de santé pour les soins pour la diarrhée teintée de sang, vomissement et déshydratation. 
En date du 14.09.2021 l’enfant est réadmis pour exacerbation des signes antérieurs et le lendemain de cette réadmission, l’enfant est décédé dans un tableau non décrit. 
Le 18 septembre 2021, le père de l’enfant consulte une autre formation sanitaire dans la même Aire de santé et il y décède.
En date du 29 septembre 2021, la petite sœur de l’enfant présente une symptomatologie similaire et décède par la suite. 
Signalons que la ville de Beni est en contact permanent avec les villes de Butembo sur l’axe Goma, et la ville de Goma le port de Kasindi vers l’Ouganda en province du Nord-Kivu, la ville de Kisangani en Province de la Tshopo et la ville de Bunia dans la Province de l’Ituri

field_reports.epi_notes_since_last_fr:
L’épicentre de la maladie est l’aire de santé de Panga dans la zone de santé de Banalia. 
La ZS de Banalia a 20 aires de santé. Pour le seul centre de Banalia avec ses 4 AS, il y a eu 5 cas confirmés dont 4 décès.
field_reports.description: Les responsables de la zone de santé de Banalia dans la province de la Tshopo en République Démocratique du Congo ont mis en garde contre l’ épidémie de méningite. Tout a commencé par la notification des cas suspects de méningite par l’infirmier titulaire de l’AS de PANGA située à 144 Km au Sud-Est de la zone de santé de Banalia à partir du 26 Avril 2021. La zone de santé de BANALIA se trouve à 128 km de la ville de KISANGANI dans la province de TSHOPO,à laquelle elle est reliée par une route praticable. Et l’AS de Panga se trouve à 144 Km au sud-Est de la zone de santé. Elles sont reliées par la rivière Aruwimi à l’aide de pirogue motorisée, ou par moto sur une route moins praticable. Pour la petite histoire, ce n’est pas la première fois que cette maladie frappe cette zone de santé. 5 ans plus tôt, une vaccination était organisée. Voilà aujourd’hui après la fin de l’immunité vaccinale, nous avons la résurgence de la maladie. Cette maladie cause une augmentation du nombre des cas et des décès dans un tableau de fièvre à température 39°C et 40 °C, de céphalée, de Raideur méningée, de vomissement en jet, de purpura et parfois la diarrhée.
field_reports.summary: L’épidémie de méningite dans le territoire de Banalia province de la Tshopo en République Démocratique du Congo

results.name: DRC: Meningitis Outbreak
results.summary:
On 7 September 2021, the National Minister of Public Health declared a meningitis epidemic in the DRC. This declaration follows confirmation by the National Institute for Biomedical Research (INRB) and the Pasteur Institute in Paris of the presence of meningococcal meningitis type W in the samples collected from some patients in the Tshopo province. The epidemiological events that aroused suspicion date back to early July 2021 following an increase in deaths in a clinical context of fever, headache, stiff neck, suggestive of meningitis. However, preliminary investigations helped to establish that the health events observed date back to the beginning of June 2021 (S23) in two mining sites in the health area (AS) of Panga, health zone (ZS) of Banalia, located north of Kisangani, capital of Tshopo province. According to the WHO epidemiological bulletin dated 13 September 2021, 301 suspected cases of meningitis, including 131 deaths, i.e., a case-fatality rate of 48.8%, have been recorded since the beginning of the epidemic. WHO further highlights the notification of 39 new suspected cases between 10 and 11 September 2021.

A few observations have emerged at this stage:

  • The outbreak remains confined to the Banalia health zone as 13/20 health areas (65%) have reported suspected cases
  • Panga Health Area remains the epicentre of the disease as 72% of suspected cases have been reported (216/301)
  • The epidemic is progressing because a new health area (St Elisabeth Health Area) has been affected in the past week according to the WHO epidemiological bulletin of 13 September 2021
  • Lethality appears to be slightly elevated (48.8%) indicating the need for rapid action at the community level.

As of 11 September 2021, 18 patients were hospitalized and treated for meningitis, including 7 in Panga, 6 in Bethsaida, 3 in Banalia General Hospital of Reference and 2 in Lukelo. According to an expert opinion from the Ministry of Health, all age groups are vulnerable to meningitis. However, the National Committee for the Fight against the disease in the DRC states in its latest report dated 8 September 2021 that the age group most affected by the current meningitis epidemic is 15 years and above. The population exposed to this meningitis epidemic resides in Banalia health zone in Tshopo province. The total population of Banalia health zone is 162,723 people, spread over 20 health areas. At present, 13 of the 20 health areas in this health zone are affected.

It is clear from the above elements, that the DRC is once more faced with the emergence of a meningitis epidemic, the latest dating back to November 2009 with 214 cases and 18 deaths (a case-fatality rate of 8%) in the town of Kisangani, still in the Province of Tshopo. For the moment, the epidemic is confined to the Banalia health zone, but is showing an evolving trend. This situation puts additional pressure on the DRC's health system already weakened by multiple health risks, the most current are the Ebola virus disease (EVD), cholera, measles and COVID-19. The situation requires the rapid involvement of RC DRC volunteers in Tshopo to slow down the progression of meningitis within communities and mitigate its impact.

field_reports.description:
Samedi 22 mai 2021 aux environs de 19 h 00 heure de Goma, le volcan Nyiragongo est entré en éruption ; cette dernière a fait couler les laves qui ont pris la direction du parc une partie et une autre s’est dirigée vers la ville de Goma précisément dans les quartiers Mutowo, Bushara, Bunyuzu, Kabingo, Bugarura, Ngangi 1, Kasenyi, Kabaya, Buhene, Mujoga, Kagura, Kitsheke et le quartier Volcan ; ces laves ont calciné tout sur leurs passages dans 17 villages du territoire de Nyiragongo.
Après cet écoulement de laves, s’en est suivi plus de 400 séismes du 23 au 27 mai 2021 qui ont provoqués des fissures dans les quartiers Majengo, Mabanga Nord et Sud, Bujovu, Virunga, Murara, Mapendo, Mikeno Kayembe et ont causé plusieurs dégâts tant matériels qu’humains à savoir ; la perte des vies humaines, les blessures, l’écoulement des maisons et bâtiments et tant d’autres. 
D’après les volcanologues de l’OVG, la probabilité de la présence des magmas dans le lac Kivu est non négligeable, situation qui risque d’aggravée encore la crise ; c’est ainsi que les autorités politico administratifs de la province du Nord Kivu, en concertation avec les autorités nationales déployées à Goma pour la circonstance, se sont résolues d’évacuer la population des quartiers touchés par les fissures survenues suite aux séismes et de les orientés dans des sites  qu’ils ont ciblés pour la circonstance.
Ayant suivi cette décision via les ondes, tôt matin du 27 mai 2021, les populations des quartiers concernés par la décision des autorités se sont dirigées pour les unes vers la cité de Sake au territoire de Masisi, au territoire de Lubero et dans la ville de Butembo pour la province du Nord Kivu ; et les autres se sont dirigées à Minova et Bukavu dans la province du Sud Kivu ; une portion de cette population a traversé les frontières pour trouver refuge au Rwanda ; afin une dernière partie a quitté les quartiers concernés par la décision d’évacuation pour s’abriter aux quartiers non concernés dans la ville de Goma.
field_reports.summary: Eruption du volcan à Goma RDC

field_reports.description:
So many children are feared missing or were separated from their families after Mount Nyiragongo erupted in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo on Saturday.
More than 8,000 people crossed into Rwanda from the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) to seek refuge following the eruption of the volcano, Rwanda's Emergency Management Ministry said Sunday.
On Sunday 23rd of May, after lava flows from Nyiragongo volcano have stopped, most of Congolese evacuated to Rubavu started returning back home. 

Despite this voluntary repatriation, multiple high magnitude earthquakes are increasing both in Goma DR Congo and Rubavu district, Western Province, Rwanda, and people are coming back to Rwanda for safety.
The volcano activity is causing terrible earthquake which is causing damages to people's houses and infrastructures in Rubavu district. Following science reports, there are high probability of other seismic activities as the damages of recent earthquakes has increased fear in communities where more than 1600 people are passing nights outside their braked houses waiting for emergency support and observing the evolution of the situation.

This represents a high risk for both of the mental and physical health of the communities as some have limited facilities to help them cope with the outside weather and the adverse effects of sleepless nights. Poisonous gases causing acid rain, might affect farmland and cattle. Which may lead to loss of income to many farmers and businesses of Rubavu District.

The seismic activity may disrupt the Kivu lake, then dangerous levels of carbon dioxide and methane could
be released. Cholera might spread quickly because of lack of sanitation in areas that people fled to, Due to
poverty, most people could not afford to rebuild their homes. Therefore, there is an emergency need in
terms of Non-Food Items, emergency food, PSS, washing facilities and COVID-19 protection kits, Shelter and
health.
field_reports.summary: Updates on preparedness and response plan for Nyiragongo volcanic eruption in Goma/Rwanda

field_reports.description:
On the night of 22nd around 18:30, Nyiragongo Volcanic which is located in the North Kivu, estimated 83 km from Rwanda, erupted and this has caused fear to the population of Ngoma and this made some to flee to Rwanda.
With this, at 23:00pm Saturday 23rd May, many crowds were fleeing with their belongings to the main border and other small borders of Rwanda while others went to higher grounds to the West of Goma. Therefore, Rwanda received more than 8700 people and most of them were women and children. Some of the main challenges were the lack enough food and Non-Food Items. 
Around 3 am of 23 may, some people started returning home, However the high magnitude earthquake has followed the event, as a result houses are getting destroyed.

On may 24th, 351 people from 111 families fled from Goma, DRC to Rubavu district leaving behind their destroyed houses, Today on May 24th 18 children were separated from their families as a new group of 111 families composed by 351 people was fleeing to Rubavu district from DR Congo while 100 Rwandans became homeless and displaced as a result of the high magnitude earthquake.

The volcano activity is causing terrible earthquake which has started causing damages to people's houses and infrastructures  in Rubavu district of the Western province in Rwanda, there is a high probability of another eruption, and this has increased fear in communities where families are passing nights outside their houses observing the evolution of the situation. This is harmful for both of  the mental and physical health of the communities as some have limited facilities to help them cope with the outside weather and the adverse effects of sleepless nights.
Poisonous gases causing acid rain, might affect farmland and cattle. Which may lead to lost of income to many farmers and businesses of Rubavu District. 
The seismic activity may disrupt the Kivu lake, then dangerous levels of carbon dioxide and methane could be released.
Cholera might spread quickly because of lack of sanitation in areas that people fled to, 
Due to poverty, most people could not afford to rebuild their homes.

Therefore, there is an emergency need in terms of Non-Food Items, emergency food, PSS, washing facilities and COVID-19 protection kits, Shelter and health
field_reports.summary: Preparedness and Response plan for Nyiragongo volcanic eruption in Goma/Rwanda

field_reports.description: Dans la soirée du samedi 22 Mai 2021 vers 18h30’, une éruption du volcan Nyiragongo a surpris la population de Goma et ses environs. Le volcan Nyiragongo se situe dans le territoire de Nyiragongo à 17 km de la ville touristique de Goma et le lac Kivu au Nord-est. Il est limité à l’Est par la république Rwandaise, à l’Ouest par le parc national de Virunga, au Nord par le territoire de Rutshuru et au Sud par la ville de Goma avec une population d’environ 288 404 habitants selon la source du Bureau territorial de Nyiragongo (statistique de 2020).

results.name: Democratic Republic of Congo - Volcano
results.summary:
The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC)  launched and Emergency Appeal seeking  a total of 11.6 million Swiss francs in order to support two National Societies – Democratic Republic of Congo Red Cross Society (DRC RC) and Rwanda Red Cross Society (RRCS) in delivering humanitarian assistance to and support early recovery for some 80,0000 people (displaced and in host communities) in the Democratic Republic of Congo (70,000 people) and Rwanda (10,000 people) affected by multiple hazards and compounding humanitarian vulnerabilities caused by the eruption of Mount Nyiragongo.

 

On Saturday 22 May 2021 at 19:00 HRS, Mount. Nyiragongo, located 10km from Goma, the lakeshore city of 1.5 million people in North Kivu Province of the Democratic Republic of Congo, suddenly erupted. The eruption appears to have been caused when fractures opened on the north east side of the crater towards the Rwanda border. A second eruption was reported at 21:30HRS due to a crack on the crater face towards Goma city, facing the Goma International Airport. This sudden volcanic eruption created panic within the population, leading to mass movement towards the south-west (from Goma to Sake town) and towards Rwanda (Rubavu). 30,000 people fled within the night, sheltering in evacuation centres, with host families or on the streets. It was reported that 288,404 people in Nyiragongo Territory were affected, 32 reported deaths, including 13 people during the evacuation of the city, 14 people burned by the lava and 5 asphyxiated by gases.

 

The DRC North Kivu Branch has received 540 requests for tracing missing children and 40 adults have been reported missing. 1,722 structures have been destroyed, but the number will continue to rise as assessments are completed, and 18km of road cut-off. Since the initial eruption, earth tremors have been felt intermittently. These are causing cracks in buildings, roads and other infrastructure placing further stress on a population that is already traumatised. The Goma Volcano Observatory (OVG) said that it registered more than 259 tremors between Saturday 22 May and Tuesday 25 May 2021, with one measuring 5.2 magnitude on the Richter scale. Authorities have shut down schools, markets, shops and several building sites as a precaution.

field_reports.description:
Endéans trois semaines, les présumés ADF ont réalisé quatre incursions meurtrières soit du 14 février au 7 mars 2021 principalement dans les villages Mambelenga, Ndalia, Bwanasura, Ndimo-Koto et Apende situés dans le groupement Bandavilemba sur l’axe Komanda-Luna en chefferie de Walese-Vonkutu, dans la zone de santé de Komanda, au Sud du territoire d’Irumu.
Respectivement le 14 et le 24 février puis le 2 et 7 mars 2021, ils ont attaqué les villages NDALIA, MAMBELENGA, NDIMO KOTO et APENDE.
Depuis lundi 8 mars il s’observe un déplacement massif des habitants d’environ vingt villages récemment secoués par des tueries perpétrées par des terroristes des ADF dans la chefferie des Walese-Vonkutu.
Des sources locales renseignent que toutes les activités sont paralysées et des écoles fermées à la suite de la psychose qui règne dans la région.
Ces attaques touchent 4 aires de santé : NDALIA, IDOHU, BWANASURA et MAMBELENGA habitées par 91 241 personnes. Tous les sites des déplacés sont vidés de leurs occupants. Le Bureau central de la Zone de santé estime que 54 744 personnes (soit) 60 % ont fait le déplacement vers d’autres localités telles que Komanda-centre, Pinzili, Pont-Ituri, Bandiboli, etc. mais aussi vers le Nord-Kivu.

field_reports.description:
Depuis le début du mois de Décembre 2020, à l’approche des élections présidentielles en République Centrafricaine (RCA), il y a eu un nombre des personnes fuyant les conflits internes dans leur pays jusqu’à se réfugier en République Démocratique du Congo (RDC) spécifiquement dans la province du Bas-Uélé, territoire de Bondo, du Nord-Ubangi, territoires de Yakoma, Mobayi Bongo et Bosobolo et du Sud-Ubangi, ville de Zongo. 

Les réfugiés qui arrivent dans ces trois provinces ont été enregistrés respectivement en date de 18 Décembre 2020, puis le 02 et le 14 Janvier 2021. Le nombre de personnes enregistrées le 14 Janvier 2021 est de 52 110 personnes soit 8685 ménages  ; malgré que la tendance est de se retrouver avec un afflux de réfugiés jusqu’à doubler le nombre, voire même à tripler.

field_reports.description:
Les pluies qui se sont abattues successivement dans la Province du Sud Ubangi depuis le mois d’aout jusqu’à ces jours ont provoqué la montée de la rivière Ubangi qui a débordé son lit et provoquant des inondations dans la ville de Zongo
Il est à noter que la situation des sinistrés continue à s’empirer du fait que les pluies continuent en ce moment.

field_reports.description:
Les pluies successives qui se sont abattues dans la province du Sud Ubangi depuis le mois d’août 2020 et qui continuent de tomber jusqu’à ces jours dans la grande partie de cette province en général, dans la ville de Zongo en particulier, ont provoquées la montée des eaux de la rivière Ubangi qui alimente le fleuve Congo dans sa partie Nord, et ceux de ces affluents ;
Cette rivière Ubangi ainsi que ses affluents continuent de recevoir les eaux des pluies venant de certains villages où il pleut presque chaque jour (Wenze, Seika, Yakiri, Banbenga et Mole …) qui se trouvent au versant Nord de la ville de Zongo et aggravent encore la situation.
C’est dans ce conditions que ces eaux ont finies par sortir de leurs lits pour inonder quatre quartiers de la ville de Zongo en détruisant des abris et de champs d’une part, et de l’autre part en causant de dégâts matériels non négligeables.
Pour refuser d’être emporter par les inondations, la population habitant les sites inondés se sont déplacés vers les familles d’accueils pour certains, d’autres dans des édifices publiques (école, église …) et pire encore une majorité de la population passe nuit à la belle étoile dans des lieux non inondés espérant voir le retour des eaux dans leurs lits pour retourner chez eux.
Comme on peut bien le constater, la situation humanitaire de ressortissant des quartiers inondés de la ville de zongo ne fait que j’empirée du jour au jour et les victimes vivent désespérément.

field_reports.description:
Les pluies diluviennes qui se sont abattues ce jeudi 1 octobre 2020 à 14 heures, à la cité de Sake et ses environs dans le territoire Masisi, province du Nord-Kivu, ont causé des dégâts matériels et des pertes en vies humaines parmi la population. La cite de Sake est située à environ 25 km de la ville de Goma avec une population de 108 249 habitants. 
Cette pluie ont provoqué des érosions ont causant des dégâts énormes en emportant le pont de la rivière KIHIRA qui rélie la route Sake-Masisi et Sake –Minova donc il ya rupture de communication entre Goma-Masisi et Goma-Sud –Kivu. Les maisons emportées par les eaux, les écoles de la place inondée, les champs, le pâturage qui avait les vaches, moutons et chèvres emportés.  Cette population vit dans les familles d’accueil
field_reports.summary: Les inondations à Sake dans le territoire Masisi, province du Nord-Kivu en RDC

field_reports.description: Les pluies diluviennes qui se sont abattues en date du 11 septembre 2020 à 15 heures 30, dans cité de Kamuntunga territoire Mwenga, province du Sud-Kivu, ont causé des éboulements de terre dans les zones minières avec des dégâts dont des pertes en vies humaines parmi la population qui se trouve dans ce site extraction d’or. Des eaux de la pluie et des pierres ont pénétré et fermé les entrées dans trois puits aurifères où se trouvaient plus de 50 mineurs.
